intro: Esula rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf esula, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its round, succulent leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, adapted to store water, while its flowers range in color from pink to purple. Esula rotundifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in tropical gardens.
